page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The whole is a sparsely populated area with predominantly small mixed farms, deciduous woodland & very few roads. The central area is dominated by Staunton Harold reservoir to which there is public access for sailing, fishing, walking,bird watching & picnicking. The outstanding feature is{Calke {Abbey,}an 18th century house on the site of an ancient priory, recently acquired by the National Trust and available to the public on a limited basis. A very interesting feature is the {Limeyards,}abandoned lime workings whose quarries are now water-filled and used for fishing. The whole area attracts many ramblers, photographers & ornithologists.
